This sweetness creeps, not just into the lyrics, but into the tone and arrangements of Sucker. ThereÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s a sunny expansiveness to these songs that markedly contrasts with noire-ish tunes from his Too Much Love debut, or IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢m Your Man. Where BoboÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s past tunes tended to slouch along on 12/8 blues progressions, with a drift of spoke-sung vocals hanging above, a stab of slide guitar as punctuation, these are more overtly tuneful and densely arranged. Jonathan Kirkscey, from the Memphis Symphony Orchestra, sits in on cello on the lilting opener. This is in addition to a full band of rock instruments Ã¢â‚¬â€œ besides Bobo himself, John Paul Keith plays guitar, Jeremy Scott bass, Paul Buchignani plays drums and Tim Prudhomme (of Fuck) contributes voice and additional percussion.
